content: aunt eda s christmas bells circa 1940 s or earlier this pattern was found among my aunt s possessions she died in 1990 at the age of 103 she was an avid walker hiker cook and crafter knitting crocheting and tatting use two or three ply yarn probably fingering or sock or sport weight and size 2 or 3 needles us for small balls use number 4 - 8 needles with 4 ply yarn most likely dk or worsted weight and use number 11 needles and 4 ply yarn aran for larger balls * this one confuses me so i ll have to try it out it seems like the needle size is too large possibly she didn t have needles in sizes between 8 and 11 *and we must keep in mind that this pattern is probably from the 1940 s or even earlier i d adapt whatever needle size will make a fairly firm material for the yarn you re using cast on 14 stitches row 1 - knit 10 purl 4 row 2 - knit repeat these two row for 22 ridges and end with a knit row bind off leaving about a 12 tail sew sides and gather top leave a loop for hanging attach a bell for the clapper
